alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 12:57PM EDT until August 12 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Delaware...southern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in northern Delaware...New Castle. In southern New Jersey... Gloucester and Salem. In southeast Pennsylvania...Delaware and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1256 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Wilmington, Chester, West Deptford, Carneys Point, Folcroft, Paulsboro, Penns Grove, Swedesboro, Arden, Chester Township, and Beckett. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 2. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 17 and 23. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 7 and 20. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
